definition: news pass quickly from mouth to mouth (idiom)/an infectious disease spreads quickly (old meaning)
pinyin: yi1 chuan2 shi2 , shi2 chuan2 bai3

definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
three men talking makes a tiger (idiom); repeated rumor becomes a fact
variant of 轟動|轰动[hong1 dong4]
to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
